definition: money wrapped in red as a gift/bonus payment/kickback/bribe
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: The boss is delighted, he's been all over the works dishing out bonuses and handshakes.
sentences.chinese: 老闆高興了，他走遍全廠分發紅包，與每個人握手。

sentences.english: The 2015 Spring Festival marked the coming of digital red packets on WeChat.
sentences.chinese: 2015年春節時，微信迎來了數字紅包。

sentences.english: The spring festival in 2015 . The red packages are not traditional .
sentences.chinese: 2015年春節紅包與往常相比變得不太一樣了。

sentences.english: They wished me a Happy New Year, every one of those.
sentences.chinese: 他們祝賀我新年快樂，還給我發了中國傳統的紅包。

sentences.english: Everyone accepted the bribe except him.
sentences.chinese: 除了他，每一個人都收紅包。

sentences.english: One had coins attached with red strings and was put at the foot of children's beds.
sentences.chinese: 一種紅包是繫有紅線的硬幣，放在孩子的被窩裏。

sentences.english: I said your this year cannot comeback, only has me to give them the new year's money the red package.
sentences.chinese: 我說你今年不會回來，唯有我給他們壓歲的紅包。

sentences.english: That's because we get presents and treats, including red envelopes filled with money.
sentences.chinese: 因爲我們可以得到禮物和樂趣，這其中就包括紅包。

sentences.english: In the past, the red envelope was just a simple red packet, without any characters printed on it.
sentences.chinese: 過去，紅包只是一個紅紙套，上面沒印任何字。

sentences.english: Other activities include lighting firecrackers and giving money in red paper envelopes.
sentences.chinese: 其他活動包括放鞭炮，還有發紅包。

sentences.english: Not only do these insects leave itchy bites, they can also spread disease.
sentences.chinese: 蚊子叮咬不僅留下瘙癢的紅包，還會傳播疾病。

sentences.english: While having the family reunion dinner on Lunar New Year’s Eve, I got lots of red envelops from my elders.
sentences.chinese: 除夕夜，喫年夜飯時，我的長輩給我許多紅包。

sentences.english: Xiao Min also believes that there have also been some positive changes in the red envelope as it has evolved.
sentences.chinese: 肖敏也認爲，送紅包的習俗也發生了一些好的變化。

sentences.english: Spring Festival this year, I received a lot of red packets, I am very happy.
sentences.chinese: 今年春節，我收了很多紅包，我很高興。

sentences.english: A man portraying the God of Wealth handed out lucky red packets to shoppers in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 在香港，扮成財神的人在向行人發紅包。

sentences.english: You received little red envelopes containing money on special occasions.
sentences.chinese: 在逢年過節時你總能收到紅包。

definition: to send/to give as a present
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
paper money/a bill (e.g. 100 yuan)/CL:張|张[zhang1],紮|扎[za1]
to celebrate the Chinese New Year
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
to/for/for the benefit of/to give/to allow/to do sth (for sb)/(grammatical equivalent of 被)/(grammatical equivalent of 把)/(sentence intensifier)
